channel.title: When ILLENIUM kinda copies your melody ðŸ˜‚
channel.description:
So I had this melody that I made a while back and I didn't know what to do with it so I left it till I got some ideas and then ILLENIUM released a song the other day and I recognised the melody and so I went on to auxy and I had the same kinda melody maybe a couple of notes difference but ha it's weird so I have just started using it to make a track check it out
My track - https://app.auxy.co/projects/-FtbykAhgMtL8KX4fPaijA==
ILLENIUM's track - https://soundcloud.com/illeniumofficial/illenium-crawl-outta-love-ft-annika-wells-1

item.source: When ILLENIUM kinda copies your melody ðŸ˜‚

item.title: When ILLENIUM kinda copies your melody ðŸ˜‚
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
Hi, I checked out both.
I think youâ€™ve done a pretty good job remaking it, but I still think the difference in production level is clear. (Perhaps Iâ€™m just too used to hearing the Auxy sounds. Maybe Iâ€™d feel differently if I wasnâ€™t familiar with Auxy.)

Aside from the choice and range of sounds used in Illeniumâ€™s original, it has significantly more punch and â€˜presenceâ€™. Much of that will come from good audio engineering, savvy use of quality reverb, compression, panning and â€“ critically â€” good EQing/mastering â€“ options that arenâ€™t available in Auxy, and which prevent it from achieving that â€˜next levelâ€™ sound. To widen it and bring it â€˜forwardâ€™.
The Auxy version feels very â€˜narrowâ€™ and blended together by comparison.

It would be interesting to hear your remake run through something like Landr, an online mastering service.
It relies on presets, but it can still add a certain something, and help you get an idea of the difference mastering can make.

Alternatively, there are likely to be a range of mastering options in FL. (I otherwise use Ableton Live, which does.). Try outputting the track stems from Auxy, bring them into FL and play about with EQ and mastering options on each part.

As I said, youâ€™ve done a pretty good job, but I donâ€™t feel Iâ€™ve been proved wrong â€“ yet

Btw, Iâ€™ll be sure to check out your Soundcloud. :followed:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: KDS_Official
item.description:
I completely get what your saying I recently just got fl studio but idk how to use it yet Iâ€™m just getting used to it so hopefully soon Iâ€™ll get the hang of it

And yeah I am gonna prove you wrong I have made an ILLENIUM song completely using auxy Iâ€™ll show you the original ILLENIUM track and my remake

Original song - https://m.soundcloud.com/illeniumofficial/illenium-kerli-sound-of-walking-away

My remake - https://m.soundcloud.com/kds_original/illenium-kerli-sound-of

You can check out my soundcloud if you like - https://m.soundcloud.com/kds_original

item.source: When ILLENIUM kinda copies your melody ðŸ˜‚

item.title: When ILLENIUM kinda copies your melody ðŸ˜‚
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I look forward to hearing the completed piece.
Do you have any pieces that you consider your best, most finished and polished?

I could be wrong, but I think youâ€™re gonna need to step up from Auxy if youâ€™re aiming for something that could sit next to the Illenium track. Structurally, itâ€™s relatively simple, sure, but even looking purely at the non-vocal elements, Auxy wonâ€™t get you close enough to that quality of production.
The sound creation, tweaking, reverb and delays options arenâ€™t of the quality or flexibility you might experience in a pro track production, not to mention the lack of proper mastering options.

(Itâ€™s not to â€˜do downâ€™ what the small team behind Auxy have achieved. Itâ€™s fantastic. But, itâ€™s still not a serious music production tool. Fantastic for sketching and initial development. Possibly unmatched on that aspect, for those who work exclusively in midi/step sequencing.)

There are some impressive things being done by Auxy users, but tracks do still tend to be recognisably â€˜Made with Auxyâ€™, at least to my ears.

Even on my best Auxy track, if I was remotely serious about a commercial release, Iâ€™d consider it necessary to rebuild and develop it outside of Auxy.

Auxy with support for Audiobus might get you closer, though (nudge, nudge, Lenberg.

 
But, as I say, I could be wrong.
(This is the bit where someone tells me that the music for the Illenium track was made entirely in Auxy - and I donâ€™t know what Iâ€™m talking about.

Iâ€™d be fine with that. Happy to learn.

Read full topic

item.description:
*ahem*

Maybe youâ€™re both simply fans of one of Hans Zimmerâ€™s most famous pieces from back in 2010

Spotify

Time

Time, a song by Hans Zimmer on Spotify

Fwiwâ„¢, a remix of the Illenium track seems to have gone up on SoundCloud about a month ago, so the Illenium â€˜originalâ€™ version has presumably been kicking around longer than that.
(I donâ€™t know who Illenium is â€” clearly Iâ€™m not down with the kids anymore â€” but the track got a Like outta me. )

Still, I look forward to hearing where you take it.
